pwa.title: Install CasaBreak
pwa.description: Install the CasaBreak app on your device for quick access and an optimal experience, even offline.
pwa.iosInstructions: To install on your iPhone or iPad:

hero.title: Discover Casablanca with CasaBreak
hero.description: CasaBreak is your urban guide to discover the best of Casablanca: tourist places, parks, attractions, street art, cinemas, shopping, restaurants, cafes and spas. Available on smartphone and tablet, quickly find an activity to do and let yourself be guided by this geolocated mobile app dedicated to outings in Casablanca.

magazine.description1: CasaBreak is an innovative mobile app designed to help you discover all the hidden treasures of Casablanca. Whether you're a resident or visitor, instantly find the best places to visit, restaurants to try, events not to miss and much more.
magazine.description1b: With an intuitive interface and precise geolocation, CasaBreak transforms your experience of the white city into a personalized and memorable adventure.
magazine.title2: All of Casablanca in your pocket
magazine.description2: The CasaBreak app gives you access to a comprehensive database of iconic places, historic monuments, neighborhoods to explore, beaches, shopping malls, and cultural activities. Each place comes with detailed information, photos, hours and reviews.
magazine.description2b: Plan your outings, create your personalized itineraries and discover Casablanca at your own pace with CasaBreak.
magazine.description3: CasaBreak revolutionizes the way you explore Casablanca. Quickly find a restaurant for dinner, a café to work, a park to relax, or a cultural event not to miss. The app adapts to your preferences and suggests the best options based on your location.
magazine.description3b: Download CasaBreak now and turn every outing into an unforgettable experience in Casablanca.

heritage.title: Memory of Casablanca
heritage.description: At the center of Casablanca, the Sacred Heart Space embodies the link between tradition and modernity. Built in the 1930s, this iconic monument bears witness to the city's rich cultural and architectural heritage. Transformed over the decades, it has managed to preserve its authenticity while reinventing itself as a space for creation and sharing. A place of memory that has become a place of life, it illustrates Casablanca's ability to make past and future dialogue.

history.title: History
history.description: Discover the fascinating history of this monument from its construction in 1930 to its transformation into a cultural center.

architecture.title: Architecture
architecture.description: Explore the architectural details, Art Deco influences and construction techniques of the era.

visits.title: Guided tours
visits.description: Join our guided tours with experts for an in-depth discovery of the heritage.

spinningCathedral.title: CasaBreak - Your Casablanca Guide
spinningCathedral.description: CasaBreak is the leading mobile app for discovering Casablanca. Find the best restaurants, cafes, attractions, events and iconic places in the white city. Available on iOS and Android.

hero.title: History
hero.description: An iconic monument of Casablanca that tells the story of the city through the 21st century
hero.photoCredit: Photo from the Flandrin Collection, private collection of the Banque Populaire Foundation

timeline.title: Historical Timeline
timeline.description: Discover the key stages that shaped the history of this iconic monument

1923.title: The beginning of a symbolic project
1923.description: The construction of the Sacred Heart Space was launched under the French protectorate, at the initiative of the Catholic community of Casablanca. It bears witness to this community's desire to assert its presence in a city in full transformation. The objective was to erect a major place of worship in the heart of a city on the rise, reflecting the rapid urban development and dynamism of the metropolis. This project thus fits into the context of Casablanca's expansion, where modernity and faith come together to give birth to an iconic monument of its time.

1930.title: The completion of an architectural masterpiece
1930.description1: The official inauguration of the Sacred Heart Space marks a major milestone in the architectural and cultural history of Casablanca. Designed by architect Paul Tournon, the building stands out for its avant-garde character, the result of a skillful marriage between Gothic art and Art Deco, a style then unprecedented in North Africa.
1930.description2: With its soaring vaults, geometric stained glass windows and clean facades, the church embodies the modernity and elegance characteristic of 1930s Casablanca. This architectural masterpiece bears witness to the aesthetic refinement of its era and the desire to make the Sacred Heart Space a strong symbol of the city, at the crossroads between religious tradition and urban innovation.

1956.title: Morocco's independence: a turning point
1956.description1: After Morocco's independence, attendance at the Sacred Heart Space gradually declined. Little by little, the building lost its initial religious function, a direct consequence of the social and demographic transformations of the city.
1956.description2: However, far from falling into oblivion, the church acquired a new status: that of a heritage and cultural symbol of Casablanca. Its remarkable architecture and its place in the heart of the city make it a place charged with history, witness to the colonial past but also to the urban and artistic evolution of modern Morocco.

1976.title: Deconsecration and change of use
1976.description1: The Sacred Heart Space is officially deconsecrated, marking the end of its religious use. This change offers it a new life as a cultural and exhibition space, open to creation and artistic dialogue.
1976.description2: From then on, the monument hosts various events such as concerts, exhibitions, screenings and numerous cultural events. This renewal transforms the building into a living and inclusive place, where heritage and modernity meet, making the Sacred Heart Space a symbol of Casablanca's cultural vitality.

1990-2000.title: Heritage recognition
1990-2000.description1: Listed among the iconic monuments of Casablanca's architectural heritage, the Sacred Heart Space occupies a special place in the city's history. With its bold reinforced concrete structure and revisited neo-Gothic style, it bears witness to the architectural genius and innovative spirit of its era.
1990-2000.description2: Its unique appearance now attracts architects, researchers and visitors from around the world, fascinated by the harmony between tradition and modernity that the building embodies. A true urban and cultural landmark, the Sacred Heart Space remains a strong symbol of Casablanca's heritage and the richness of its artistic legacy.

2010.title: Beginning of rehabilitation
2010.description1: Restoration and security work was undertaken to preserve the Sacred Heart Space, weakened by time and years of exposure to the elements. These interventions aim to safeguard the solidity of the building while respecting its original architecture, a strong symbol of Casablanca's heritage.
2010.description2: At the same time, a clear will emerges: to give new life to this historic monument by transforming it into a true center of creativity and cultural dialogue. The objective is to make it a place open to all, where arts, ideas and generations meet, thus perpetuating the living and inspiring spirit of the Sacred Heart Space.

today.label: Today
today.title: Renaissance of a heritage jewel
today.description1: The site of the Sacred Heart Space is reborn today as a true cultural, artistic and tourist center, symbol of the vitality and renewal of Casablanca. This iconic place transforms into a space of encounter between memory and modernity, where heritage, art, innovation and citizenship intersect.
today.description2: By hosting exhibitions, events and creative initiatives, the Sacred Heart Space now fits into a sustainable approach to enhancing Casablanca's heritage. It embodies the will to preserve history while reinventing it, offering the city a living, inspiring space open to the world.
today.audioTitle: Listen to the story of today

cta.title: Explore the Architecture
cta.description: Dive into the exceptional architectural details of the Sacred Heart Space. Discover how Art Deco and modernism meet in this unique masterpiece.
cta.label: Art Deco Architecture

architect.title: Paul Tournon
architect.description: The visionary architect who designed the Ex Church Sacred Heart of Casablanca, a masterpiece of Moroccan Art Deco

portrait.label: Architect of the Ex Sacred Heart Church

biography.title: Biography
biography.paragraph1: French architect born in Marseille, Paul Tournon graduated from the École des Beaux-Arts in Paris. Winner of the Second Grand Prix de Rome in 1911, he distinguished himself by his ability to unite spirituality, modernity and technique.
biography.paragraph2: Pioneer in the use of reinforced concrete for religious buildings, he marries innovation with great artistic sensitivity. His revolutionary approach transformed the sacred architecture of his time.
biography.paragraph3: In 1930, he designed the Sacred Heart of Casablanca, a masterpiece that combines neo-Gothic and art deco styles, magnified by light and Moroccan volumes. Tournon was also chief architect of Civil Buildings and National Palaces and a member of the Academy of Fine Arts.

achievements.title: Major Achievements
achievements.achievement1: Second Grand Prix de Rome in 1911
achievements.achievement2: Chief Architect of Civil Buildings and National Palaces
achievements.achievement3: Member of the Academy of Fine Arts
achievements.achievement4: Pioneer of reinforced concrete in religious architecture

philosophy.title: Architectural Philosophy
philosophy.description: Paul Tournon believed in an architecture that transcends eras, where spirituality meets technical innovation. His work embodies a harmonious dialogue between spiritual heritage and architectural modernity.
philosophy.quote: Architecture must elevate the soul while serving function

hero.title: Architecture
hero.description: A masterpiece of Moroccan Art Deco combining Gothic tradition and modernity
hero.imageAlt: Architecture of the Sacred Heart Space

artDeco.title: Between Art Deco and spiritual modernism
artDeco.description: The architecture of the Sacred Heart Space is a pioneering work of the Moroccan Art Deco movement, where spirituality and technical innovation meet. The choice of reinforced concrete, an innovative material at the time, allowed the creation of vertiginous volumes, soaring vaults, and an interior space of exceptional luminous lightness. The rhythmic openings of stained glass windows let in filtered light, transforming each ray into a colored vibration on the white walls.
artDeco.audioTitle: Listen: Between Art Deco and spiritual modernism

culturalAlliance.title: A subtle alliance between cultures
culturalAlliance.description: The building's aesthetic evokes a dialogue between European and Arab-Andalusian styles. The geometric lattices that decorate the facades recall local craftsmanship, while the two soaring bell towers echo Islamic architecture. This hybridization makes the Sacred Heart Space a unique symbol of 1930s Casablanca, a city of exchanges and cultural coexistence.
culturalAlliance.audioTitle: Listen: A subtle alliance between cultures

restoration.title: A respectful and innovative restoration
restoration.description: During the renovation, each element was treated with care: the pillars, vaults, stained glass windows and domes were cleaned, consolidated and durably protected. Particular attention was paid to acoustics, with the addition of absorbing panels to reduce reverberation while preserving the monumental volume. Contemporary interventions, sober and reversible, integrate harmoniously into the original structure, revealing the geometric power and architectural purity of the building.
restoration.audioTitle: Listen: A respectful and innovative restoration

livingSpace.title: A living and modular space
livingSpace.description: Thanks to its interior modularity, the Sacred Heart Space now adapts to new functions: exhibitions, concerts, conferences, artistic installations or performances. Its grandiose proportions and natural light offer a unique setting where heritage dialogues with contemporary creation.
livingSpace.audioTitle: Listen: A living and modular space

hero.title: Monuments & Iconic Places
hero.description: Discover the iconic monuments that make Casablanca famous

hassan2.title: Hassan II Mosque
hassan2.description: The Hassan II Mosque is the absolute symbol of Casablanca. Built partly on the ocean, it impresses with its 210-meter minaret, the tallest in the world, and its refined architecture combining zellige, sculpted marble and cedar wood. It is one of the few religious sites in Morocco open to non-Muslim visitors, making it an essential stop. Guided tours allow you to discover the majestic prayer hall, patios and spectacular views of the Atlantic. A grandiose monument, to be experienced both day and night.

habous.title: Habous Quarter
habous.description: The Habous Quarter, also called "New Medina", is a harmonious blend of traditional Moroccan architecture and colonial urbanism. Its clean alleys, arcades and bright squares make it a pleasant place to stroll. The quarter is famous for its bookstores, leather craftsmen, traditional clothing shops and mythical Moroccan pastry shops. You can also find the Mahkama du Pacha, an architectural masterpiece. It is one of the most authentic places in Casablanca, ideal for discovering quality craftsmanship and a calm atmosphere.

medina.title: Old Medina
medina.description: The Old Medina represents the historic heart of Casablanca. Smaller and less touristy than those of other Moroccan cities, it offers a real immersion into local life: small shops, traditional markets, lively alleys and everyday scenes. You can discover the Sqala, an old fort converted into a café-restaurant, as well as period ramparts. It's a perfect place to feel the history of Casa and observe its authenticity. Ideal for a cultural walk, accompanied by a few stops in the small local shops.

artdeco.title: Art Deco City Center
artdeco.description: Casablanca has one of the most beautiful Art Deco heritages in the world. The city center, built in the 1920s–1940s, is full of geometric facades, worked balconies, wrought iron doors and historic buildings. Walking along Mohammed V Boulevard or the side streets, you discover iconic buildings: period hotels, old cinemas, banks, residential buildings. This quarter represents the elegance of old cosmopolitan Casablanca. Guided tours allow you to fully appreciate this unique heritage.

sacrecoeur.title: Sacred Heart Space
sacrecoeur.description: Built in 1930, the former Sacred Heart Church is a remarkable example of neo-Gothic architecture with an Art Deco touch. Although it is no longer a place of worship, it now hosts exhibitions, cultural events and artistic installations. Its imposing appearance, bright interior and stylized stained glass windows make it a unique place in Casablanca. Located on the edge of the Arab League Park, it is an essential cultural and architectural stop to discover the colonial past of the city.

cta.title: Discover Casablanca
cta.description: Explore these iconic monuments on a guided tour or independently
